summary: The Bhagavad Gita is an ancient Hindu text, part of the epic Mahabharata. It's a conversation between Prince Arjuna and his guide Krishna, who is an avatar of the god Vishnu. The Gita teaches about duty, or dharma, and how to live a good life. Krishna encourages Arjuna to fight in an upcoming battle, seeing it as his duty, and to trust in God. The text also talks about different paths to self-realization, like meditation, wisdom, action, and devotion. Many people have studied and interpreted the Gita's teachings over the centuries.
title: Bhagavad Gita
